intro: Hibbertia cistoidea, commonly known as the Cistoidea Hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia cistoidea has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
